battleship
Class GameLogic

java.lang.Object
  battleship.GameLogic

public class GameLogic
extends java.lang.Object

GameLogic class. This class is the main backbone of all logic based processing required for the game to run according to the rules, as well as does some process handling for sending out packets.

          Default constructor, passes in current Connection

checkGameOver

public static void checkGameOver()
Checks to see if a game over has occurred clientside. If so, it will continue processing the game over.

setBounds

public static boolean setBounds(int x1,
                                int x2,
                                int y1,
                                int y2,
                                int size,
                                Ship ship)
Checks the bounds of the user's input range. If the spot is available, the ship will be placed. If not, the user will have to try again.

Parameters:
x1 - Beginning X Point
x2 - Ending X Point
y1 - Beginning Y Point
y2 - Ending Y Point
size - Size of the ship
ship - Actual ship object.
Returns:

playerFire

public static int playerFire(java.lang.String cords)
When the player fires an attack, this is invoked.

Parameters:
cords - Coordinates of attack
Returns:
returns 2 to mark the area has been attacked, will be updated later if the result is a hit.

fireResults

public static void fireResults(int r)
Updates the button that launched an attack. Sets the image of the button corresponding to what has happened.

Parameters:
r - value of results

enemyFire

public static java.lang.String enemyFire(java.lang.String cord)
When the player has been attacked, this handles the buttons and potential ship damage. Returns a string representing the events.

Parameters:
cord - Coordinates of attack.
Returns:
String of information regarding the outcome
